intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron clusiophyllum, commonly known as the red-leaved elaeodendron, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae, also known as the guttiferae, and is characterized by its distinctive red or orange-colored leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The leaves are not only visually striking but also have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
